alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 30 at 3:30PM AKST until December 31 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Northeast winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From noon Thursday to 6 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow will reduce visibilities to as low as one half mile. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A front moving through the Kuskokwim Delta is resulting in reduced visibility as a result of blowing snow. The heaviest snow, and accompanying worst visibility, will move from south to north across the Delta through tonight. With winds reaching 35 mph, locations along the coast may see visibility as low as one quarter mile at times. Early Friday morning, snowfall rates and winds will decrease, leading to improved conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
